CatDescriptText: Mrs. William Hughes, Groveton, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think children should be given 'allowances' (money)? If so, for what reason or reasons (just to have spending money or for chores done around the home, etc.)?  Do you think that it helps or hinders the development of the youngster?" answer reads: "I do, and the allowance should be given for work done.  This will teach children the value of money, and the fact that it does not come too easily."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Mrs. William Hughes wearing sleeveless horse patterned dress, standing with two teenagers, and two children,in front of stores, including one with sign reading "Clean...Paint...Fix..."
